sentences: Daichi Miura (三浦 大知, Miura Daichi, born 24 August 1987) is a Japanese singer, songwriter, dancer, and choreographer.
When Miura was eight years old, he bought a CD for the first time (HIStory by Michael Jackson).
In 1996, a television program (NHK Education's Yumediago Kodomojuku) featured Miura commuting to the dance school 90 minutes by bus from home.
In 1996, a television program (NHK Education's Yumediago Kodomojuku) featured Miura commuting to the dance school 90 minutes by bus from home.
In 1997, Miura started his career as a member of Folder.
section: == Career == | === Debut as a member of Folder ===

sentences: In 2000, he took a hiatus from Folder due to his voice change.
section: == Career == | === Debut as a member of Folder ===
== Career == | === 2004:  Comeback concert as Daichi Miura ===

sentences: On 1 August, at Harajuku Astro Hall (VISION FESTA vol.2), he changed his stage name back to Daichi Miura and held a comeback concert.
In the summer, J. Que (Patrick J. Que Smith, the composer of Usher's "Yeah!") came to Japan to write songs for Miura.
During the week in the studio, they produced a few songs together.
On 9 December, Miura traveled to Los Angeles to shoot the music video of the debut song "Keep It Goin' On".
On 16 December, Miura danced with top dancers including the backup dancers for Beyonce, Usher etc.
